page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT:WOODTON AREA
page.content: There are 61 people here,who are potentially in gainful employment,54% of these have to go outside the parishes to work,36% work in the area, either farming (11%),self-employed or in family businesses (16%),or as farm- workers (7%).This compares with 32% working on the land in 1881,& with everyone else working within the area. There are also 6 unemployed men & 1 one-parent family.Of those working outside the area,6 work for large firms such as Clay's,Printers of Bungay,or Colman's & Mackintosh's, Norwich.Most have skilled jobs:lorry drivers,machine operators or Telecom engineers.Included in the professions are insurance brokers,nurses, secretaries & engineers.One man works in Saudi Arabia,& 2 work in the oil industry, as one might expect in East Anglia.
